media.description: Gyeonu and Eunho have been together since their childhood as neighbors and friends, however, as Eunho goes through her new-found college life, she becomes aware of her neighbor's secret. A cute slice-of-life with a supernatural twist.
Music video animated by Mogelatte for the song Suiyoubi no Yakusoku: Another Story by HoneyWorks featuring Sora Amamiya.
Music video for Morfonica's song Daylight from the BanG Dream! project.

The Warring States Period is a time of feuding warlords. Oda Nobunaga, the greatest of them all, is reborn in modern-day Japan... as a shiba-inu! The other generals of the era, too, have also inexplicably been reborn as dogs. Their warring states rivalry will resume at the dog park!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
Music video of OTMGirls feat. Aggretsuko performing the song 'Aggressive Girl'

title.userPreferred: Do You Love Your Mom and Her Two-Hit Multi-Target Attacks?: Do You Love Your Mom on the Shore?

media.description:
Unaired 13th episode.

To thank the group for all their hard work in the past, Shirase invites the party to enjoy the sunny beach. While enjoying the wonderful weather and pristine waters, an accident causes Masato to lose all his memories, including those of Mamako!

(Source: Funimation)

In the year 2043, Infinite Dendrogram, the world's first successful full-dive VRMMO was released. In addition to its ability to perfectly simulate the five senses, along with its many other amazing features, the game promised to offer players a world full of infinite possibilities.

Nearly two years later, soon-to-be college freshman, Reiji Mukudori, is finally able to buy a copy of the game and start playing. With some help from his experienced older brother, Shuu, and his partner Embryo, Reiji embarks on an adventure into the world of Infinite Dendrogram. Just what will he discover and encounter in this game world known for its incredible realism and infinite possibilities?

(Source: J-Novel Club)
Music video for the song Go Just Go! celebrating the 5th anniversary of The IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls: Starlight Stage mobile game. Animated by studio CloverWorks.
Music video animated by Kanata for the song Kakkoyoku Naritai by HoneyWorks featuring Gero, with art by SuperciderX.
The second season of Fei Ren Zai.

Music video animated by Hanul for the song Wanderer by Ayase from YOASOBI featuring Satomi from the musical group Strawberry Prince.

Note: There exists two versions of this song; the original featuring Satomi from Strawberry Prince, and a vocaloid version featuring Miku Hatsune, both were uploaded on the same date.

It's the highlight of GBN’s anniversary event, the “Gunpla Battle One-Day Battle Royal”! Participants are selected from the Divers who played most passionately this season, and they're fighting in machines randomly assigned mainly from those Gunpla ranked highest by all Divers in the Great Gunpla Ballot! Now the final round is about to begin, with the tough fighters who've won their respective blocks! There, an unpredictable, super special, never-seen-before Gunpla dream battle will… START!!!
Music video for the song 'Sakugasaku' by Uchikubi Gokumon Doukoukai. Animated by Wit Studio.

Inside a labyrinthine library exist the souls of the world’s greatest writers. Now, these Alchemists must delve into the stories of old and do whatever is necessary to carry them out to their proper conclusions. Evil beings are hell-bent on destroying these stories, and the authors must believe in each other to stop them. There is only one way for this to end!

(Source: Funimation)

title.userPreferred: Gundam: G no Reconguista II - Bellri Gekishin

media.description: The second film compiling the Gundam: G no Reconguista TV series.

title.userPreferred: A life that cannot contact you

media.description: Music video for the song 'A life that cannot contact you' by Takayan.

The history of -IF- world has been distorted and cardfights do not exist. Ibuki and Suiko get involved with Emi and Shuka.

A journey to regain the true history by four people begins—!

(Source: Cardfight!! Vanguard Wiki)

title.userPreferred: Crayon Shin-chan: Gekitotsu! Rakugaki Kingdom to Hobo Yonin no Yuusha

media.description:
The year 20XX. Humans called "Concodes" and ultra-high-performance AI called "Codeman" team up as buddies to compete in the card battle game ZENONZARD. People are going wild with excitement at the world championships, THE ZENON.

One day, Souta Azuma, an average high school student, is challenged to a battle by a mysterious woman, Eilietta Lash. She reveals that she’s a Codeman and that her intent is to team up with Souta and participate in THE ZENON. Souta reluctantly agrees. Souta and Eilietta’s first opponent turns out to be the super-famous player Shion Saionji, who attends Souta’s school, and her buddy, Ash Claude.

(Source: Zenonzard YouTube channel)

Unaired 14th episode included in the second Blu-ray/DVD box volume.

Azalie recalls the time she and Childman found the Sword of Baldanders and Orphen gets ready to leave for Kimluck.

(Source: Funimation)

The anime centers on para-athletes who all meet an outcast sports scientist named Ren Narita. The anime has four stories about four different sports: wheelchair basketball, track and high jump, goalball, and paralympic swimming.

(Source: Anime News Network)

snailchan got into some weird dream...

Music video for the song Imaginary Express by Snail’s House from the album "Imaginarium".
Short Nescafé commercial realized by Studio FILMONY and directed by Yuusuke Takase
The third season of Fei Ren Zai.
The anime will stream exclusively in the The IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls and The IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls Starlight Stage smartphone games.
Animated music video for Kaf’s song Keshiki. This track is also used as the ending song for Japan Sinks 2020‘s final episode.
Eighth season of Huyao Xiao Hongniang.
An old man well into his 60s makes the hearts of old ladies flutter with his handsome speech and charming behavior.

Eiichiro Oda's One Piece manga is collaborating with the japanese boy band Arashi on a music video to be released on January 4. Jun Matsumoto from Arashi commented that the timing of the collaboration was chosen to coincide with both the One Piece anime and Arashi's 20th anniversaries.
Music video directed by Ryoji Yamada for the song Philip by millennium parade.

"Love always wins and I always lose, and that’s fine."

Music video for the song Neo-Neon by DECO*27 featuring Hatsune Miku.

Adaptation of Kei Ii's mystery novel.

The story is set in 1909 during Japan's Meiji era, and centers on fictional versions of real-life poet Takuboku Ishikawa and real-life linguist Kyousuke Kindaichi, who were acquaintances in real life. Takuboku runs a private detective agency to support his family. Both begin to investigate a case of supposed ghost appearances at the Asakusa Junikai building, also known as the Ryounkai.

(Source: Anime News Network)

Commercial for Kanebo Cosmetics' KATE brand featuring Rei Ayanami.

Note: There are 2 versions of this CM,「綾波レイ、はじめての口紅」and 「綾波レイ、はじめての口紅、その後」, with the second being a slightly longer version.

Since her childhood, Su Xiao has been sidelined because of her frightening aura. Now an actress, she unfortunately remains stuck in the roles of villains.

One day, Xiao Jian, a well-known investor and actor, comes across a scene between Su Xiao and his manager. In order to silence him, Su Xiao signs a contract with him.

The story follows the coming-of-age of Natsuna Keyaki, a college student from Tokyo who goes to Kumamoto after losing contact with her friend after the 2016 earthquakes. There, she meets individuals with colorful personalities, such as middle school girl Izumi, who begin to light a passion in Natsuna.

(Source: Anime News Network, edited)

A concept movie animated by FLAT STUDIO for the All Nippon Esthetic Association (AEA).

The friendship between "Saki" who aims to be an esthetician and "Umi" who aims to be a model expresses that "by being close to a person, you can change that person little by little and eventually change the world."

(Source: Official Site)

Music video by 22/7 performing their sixth single Kaze wa Fuiteru ka?

This is the theme song for the group's rhythm mobile game "22/7 Ongaku no Jikan"
A music video animated by Arawi Keiichi, featuring characters from Helvetica Standard.
Mini anime series of Minegishi-san wa Ootsu-kun ni Tabesasetai.
Mini anime for Munou na Nana released weekly on the official Twitter and website.
Music video directed by Yoshitoshi Shinomiya for the song Bouken-tai: Mori no Yuusha by Chiaki Mayumura.

Based on the action RPG of the same name.

The story follows a man's journey seeking revenge on a dragon who stole his heart. On his way, the man is brought back to life as an ‘Arisen’. An action adventure about a man challenged by demons who represent the seven deadly sins of humans.

(Source: Netflix)

Second season of Kyouryuu Shoujo Gauko.

Naoko and her friends have more strange adventures with aliens, robots and dinosaur girl Gauko. Their ordinary town has its share of oddities!

(Source: Netflix)
The story follows the daily life of Xiao Luo, a young yama (god and judge of the dead) who is scared of ghosts. In order to reign properly in the Underworld, she will try to face her fears.
Commercial for Kao's Attack ZERO products featuring Rei Ayanami.

Set in the grand blue skies up above, the depths of darkness, elder sisters, knights, gentlemen, Vyrn lovers― all the colorful crew members will get to shine in a whole new light! "Kept you waiting, huh? It's time for you to see our final forms!" Join us and take flight to the world in the skies!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
